tool.help:
Sinto: single-cell analysis tools -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- An ATAC-seq fragment file can be created from a BAM file using the fragments command. The fragment file contains the position of each Tn5 integration site, the cell barcode associated with the fragment, and the number of times the fragment was sequenced. PCR duplicates are collapsed.
**Input** A BAM file. Alignments in the input BAM file must contain cell barcodes either as a part of read names or in a tag (typically, in CB tag).
**Output** The fragment file. It contains the positions of Tn5 integration sites, the cell barcode that the DNA fragment originated from, and the number of times the fragment was sequenced.
